searchDocs.title: Introduction to new centralized documentation
searchDocs.content: Dear colleagues, I trust this message finds you well. In our ongoing efforts to enhance communication and transparency between the business and development teams, I am pleased to announce the implementation of a new centralized documentation portal for the SoundScapeExplorer project. This portal serves as a comprehensive hub for all project-related documentation, updates, and other pertinent information. It is designed to function as a showcase for the platform, providing a convenient space to publish evolving documentation for upcoming versions while archiving the older ones. Additionally, it facilitates easy export of documentation in PDF format, enabling offline access for your convenience. I invite you to use and share the following link to others:sound-scape-explorer.github.io Your feedback on this initiative is highly valuable, and I encourage you to share any thoughts or suggestions you may have. Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to further advancing our collaboration through improved access to project information. Best regards, Bamdad

searchDocs.title: Get in touch
searchDocs.content: Get in touch Join us on Discord

searchDocs.title: Available audio formats and codecs
searchDocs.content: Available audio formats and codecs These following formats have been tested with multiple sampling rates, bit depths and variable bitrate (for lossy codecs) wavmp3flac

searchDocs.title: Visualisation online
searchDocs.content: Visualisation online The Front module is available online. Please remember that you need to serve audio files yourself if you want to access to audio visualization features.

searchDocs.title: Context​
searchDocs.content: Use this command to extract the .xlsx configuration file from an existing.h5 storage file.  The extracted storage.h5-config-VERSION.xlsx is the actual configuration used to create the storage file.

searchDocs.title: Run​
searchDocs.content: Open a shell window. (Double click start.bat on Windows or use cd on Ubuntu / macOS)Type sse_config followed by a <space>Drag and drop your .h5 storage file to the shell windowPress Enter  Example:  # Windows sse_config C:\to\storage.h5 # Ubuntu / macOS sse_config path/to/storage.h5

searchDocs.title: Python venv activation
searchDocs.content: Python venv activation # bash . venv/bin/activate # fish source venv/bin/activate.fish # powershell .\venv\Scripts\activate

searchDocs.title: User flow
searchDocs.content: User flow

searchDocs.title: Windows​
searchDocs.content: Open the v11.9.0 release pageScroll to AssetsDownload the Source code (zip) fileExtract the downloaded archive (Extract here)Open the extracted folder sound-scape-explorer-VERSIONDouble click on start.bat. Wait for venv creation if neededEnter command pnpm iEnter command pnpm install:frontEnter command pnpm install:processing:windows. If you get an nvidia-*error, please use command pnpm install:processing:cpu:windowsClose the shellYou can now run a campaign

searchDocs.title: Ubuntu / macOS​
searchDocs.content: Open the v11.9.0 release pageScroll to AssetsDownload the Source code (zip) fileExtract the downloaded archive (Extract here)Open the extracted folder sound-scape-explorer-VERSIONOpen a new terminalType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-VERSION. (You can also drag and drop the sound-scape-explorer-VERSION folder)Enter command python3.10 -m venv venvEnter command . venv/bin/activateEnter command pnpm iEnter command pnpm install:frontEnter command pnpm install:processing. If you get an nvidia-*error, please use command pnpm install:processing:cpuClose the terminalYou can now run a campaign

searchDocs.title: Installation procedure​
searchDocs.content: Go to brew.sh and follow the instructions to install HomebrewOpen a terminalInstall external libraries:  brew install gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@16 pnpm   Update your $PATH:  echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/node@16/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile'   You can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Xcode command line tools​
searchDocs.content: If you encounter problems installing Homebrew, you need to install Xcode command line tools.  Note To check if Xcode command line tools are installed, run: xcode-select -p   Open a terminalRun xcode-select --installContinue to Install requirements

searchDocs.title: Installation procedure​
searchDocs.content: Click on the start menu (or press Win button on your keyboard)Type PowerShellRight-click on the PowerShell iconSelect Run as Administrator (this will open a new shell window)Navigate to chocolatey installation pageScroll to the installation commandCopy the commandPaste it in your shell windowPress Enter (Wait and type choco --version to verify installation)Install Python:  choco install python3 --version=3.10.11 -y   Note If you have a prior version of Python and want to uninstall it. Run the following command choco uninstall python3   Install Node.js:  choco install nodejs --version=16.20.0 -y   Install ffmpeg, curl and pnpm:  choco install ffmpeg curl pnpm -y   Close the shell window.Navigate to Microsft C++ Build ToolsClick on Download Build Tools to download the executableRun the executable (continue until you get the menu Installing - Visual Studio Build Tools...)Tick Desktop development with C++Press Install (6 Gb of disk space will be used)Wait for completion, you can close the Visual Studio Build Tools windowYou can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Installation procedure​
searchDocs.content: Open a terminalInstall external libraries:  sudo apt install curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools -y   Install Python:  Note Press Enter when you are prompted to add the apt repository  sudo apt install software-properties-common -y && \ sudo add-apt-repository ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && \ sudo apt install python3.10 python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv -y && \ curl -sS https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | python3.10   Update .bashrc:  sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/python python /usr/bin/python3.10 0 && \ echo "alias python=python3.10" >> ~/.bashrc && \ echo "alias pip=pip3" >> ~/.bashrc && \ source ~/.bashrc   Install Node.js:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg && \ sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings && \ curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_16.x nodistro main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install nodejs -y   Install pnpm:  sudo npm -g i pnpm   Close the terminalYou can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Modules​
searchDocs.content: There are 3 modules shipped with SSE:  Module	DescriptionProcessing	The actions responsible for processing your audio files. Front	The user interface running in the web browser. Audio	The web server to provide audio files in order to play them back in the browser.

searchDocs.title: Module guides​
searchDocs.content: Processing user guide  Visualisation user guide

searchDocs.title: Compatibility​
searchDocs.content: While the web app is compatible with most browsers, we experienced random issues with Firefox on Windows 11 and Safari on macOS 14. Thus, we recommend using Chrome.

searchDocs.title: sse_vis command​
searchDocs.content: sse_vis is only available if you have installed the Processingmodule.  This is the quickest command to start both Audio and Front modules.  On an active venv shell window, type the following to start both services (replace the path to your configuration file by drag and dropping the file Excel icon into your shell):  # Windows sse_vis C:\path\to\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS (venv)$> sse_vis /path/to/config.xlsx   After pressing <Enter>, both modules will start and your default browser will open.  Note You can also use sse_viz or viz as aliases to the sse_vis command.

searchDocs.title: audio:front command​
searchDocs.content: You can serve both Front and Audio modules at the same time  # Windows pnpm audio:front:windows Z:\audio_folder_example # Ubuntu / macOS pnpm audio:front relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: audio command​
searchDocs.content: Serve Audio module on port 5531  pnpm audio -- relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: front command​
searchDocs.content: Serve Front module on port 5530  pnpm front

searchDocs.title: Sections​

searchDocs.title: Requirements​
searchDocs.content: System requirements installedSSE modules installed

searchDocs.title: Windows​
searchDocs.content: Copy the example folder new-campaign located in sound-scape-explorer-11.9.0/examples/campaignsPaste the example folder where you want and rename itOpen your campaign folder and edit the .xlsx configuration fileIn your sound-scape-explorer-VERSION folder, double click on start.batYou can now use SSE modules

searchDocs.title: Ubuntu / macOS​
searchDocs.content: Copy the example folder new-campaign located in sound-scape-explorer-11.9.0/examples/campaignsRename the folder to whatever you wantOpen your campaign folder and edit the .xlsx configuration fileOpen a terminalType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-11.9.0Enter command . venv/bin/activateYou can now use SSE modules

searchDocs.title: Run​
searchDocs.content: Open a shell window. (Double click start.bat on Windows or use cd on Ubuntu / macOS)Type sse followed by a <space>Drag and drop your Excel file to the shell windowPress Enter  Example:  # Windows sse D:\campaign\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS sse campaign/config.xlsx

searchDocs.title: Most frequent use case​
searchDocs.content: If you want to execute all the requested metrics declared in your configuration file, please use the Run All menu choice.  Select Run AllWait for the processing to complete. When the menu displays again, the processing has completedYou can now go further to visualisation user guide in order to display your data

searchDocs.title: Menu​
searchDocs.content: You will get the menu below.  Use you arrow and Enter keys to navigate through it.  👋 Welcome to SoundScapeExplorer! ┏━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┓ ┃ File ┃ Path ┃ ┡━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┩ │ config │ relative/or/absolute/path/to/config.xlsx │ │ storage │ relative/or/absolute/path/to/storage.h5 │ └─────────┴───────────────────────────────────────────┘ ? Choose your action (Use arrow keys) ❯ Refresh configuration Run extractions and aggregations Run reductions --------------- Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix (needed for autocluster) Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix --------------- Run autoclusters Run trajectories Run digests --------------- Run all Export dataframe as .csv Export computation UMAPs as .npy Export mean distances matrix as .npy Repack storage with `h5repack` (UNIX only) --------------- Quit

searchDocs.title: Commands​
searchDocs.content: Refresh configurationRun extractions and aggregationsRun reductionsRun computation UMAPs and mean distances matrixPurge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrixRun autoclustersRun trajectoriesRun digestsRun allExport dataframeExport computation UMAPsExport mean distances matrixRepack storageQuit

searchDocs.title: Refresh configuration command​
searchDocs.content: Digest your Excel configuration file and copy all its information inside your storage file.  Note You will need to run this again if you change your configuration file.

searchDocs.title: Run extractions and aggregations command​
searchDocs.content: Extract data from your audio files either through neural networks or indicators algorithms.  Take the raw data and aggregate them using your integration settings.  Note These raw data can optionally be stored with the persist option.

searchDocs.title: Run reductions command​
searchDocs.content: Take the aggregated data produced by neural networks and reduce them using your reducers settings.

searchDocs.title: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix command​
searchDocs.content: Run the necessary data for autoclusters to be performed.  Those data will never be read in the Front so you can use the purge command to remove it from your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix command​
searchDocs.content: Remove computation data from your storage file as it will not be consumed by the Front.

searchDocs.title: Run autoclusters command​
searchDocs.content: Automatically attribute numerical clusters (groups) of intervals that are related together depending on your settings.  These clusters will appear in the Front as standard labels.

searchDocs.title: Run trajectories command​
searchDocs.content: Compute the coordinates of the requested trajectories.

searchDocs.title: Run digests command​
searchDocs.content: Take aggregated data and produce derived data using digesters algorithms.

searchDocs.title: Run all command​
searchDocs.content: Run all the commands necessary for a complete campaign.

searchDocs.title: Export dataframe command​
searchDocs.content: Exports all intervals and associated data to a .csv file.

searchDocs.title: Export computation UMAPs command​
searchDocs.content: Exports all computation UMAPs to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Export mean distances matrix command​
searchDocs.content: Exports the mean distances matrix to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Repack storage command​
searchDocs.content: When you overwrite a lot to your storage file, the space that was occupied by the deleted dataset is not immediately freed. This is due to how the HDF5 technology works.  Repacking allows you to create a new file with your data but with the smallest possible size.  Note This command is only available on UNIX systems at the moment. On Debian based distributions, install it with sudo apt install hdf5-tools

searchDocs.title: Quit command​
searchDocs.content: When the Processing module is running, your storage file is kept open thus not available to other programs to reading from it.  Use this to properly close and release your storage file.

searchDocs.title: App architecture
searchDocs.content: App architecture Please find below a quick overview of the different domains of the app and how they connect to each other.

searchDocs.title: Exporting documentation as PDF​
searchDocs.content: Please run the command below to export the whole documentation to PDF.  note Some hypertext links will not be converted.  To download the current latest version of the documentation, run  npx docs-to-pdf \ --initialDocURLs="https://sound-scape-explorer.github.io/docs" \ --contentSelector="article" \ --paginationSelector="a.pagination-nav__link.pagination-nav__link--next" \ --excludeSelectors=".margin-vert--xl a,[class^='tocCollapsible'],.breadcrumbs,.theme-edit-this-page" \ --coverImage="https://sound-scape-explorer.github.io/img/logo.png" \ --cssStyle=":root{background: transparent}" \ --coverTitle="SoundScapeExplorer Docs 11.10.0" \ --outputPDFFilename="SoundScapeExplorer-docs-11.10.0.pdf"   If you want the upcoming unreleased version, run  npx docs-to-pdf \ --initialDocURLs="https://sound-scape-explorer.github.io/docs/next" \ --contentSelector="article" \ --paginationSelector="a.pagination-nav__link.pagination-nav__link--next" \ --excludeSelectors=".margin-vert--xl a,[class^='tocCollapsible'],.breadcrumbs,.theme-edit-this-page" \ --coverImage="https://sound-scape-explorer.github.io/img/logo.png" \ --cssStyle=":root{background: transparent}" \ --coverTitle="SoundScapeExplorer Docs Next" \ --outputPDFFilename="SoundScapeExplorer-docs-next.pdf"

searchDocs.title: Exporting blog as PDF​
searchDocs.content: Please run the command below to export the blog to PDF.  npx docs-to-pdf \ --initialDocURLs="https://sound-scape-explorer.github.io/blog/index" \ --contentSelector="article" \ --paginationSelector="a.pagination-nav__link.pagination-nav__link--next" \ --excludeSelectors=".margin-vert--xl a,[class^='tocCollapsible'],.breadcrumbs,.theme-edit-this-page" \ --coverImage="https://sound-scape-explorer.github.io/img/logo.png" \ --cssStyle=":root{background: transparent}" \ --coverTitle="SoundScapeExplorer Blog 2023-10-19" \ --outputPDFFilename="SoundScapeExplorer-blog-2023-10-19.pdf"

searchDocs.content: Visualisation online The Front module is available online. Please remember that you need to serve audio files yourself if you want to access to audio visualization features.

searchDocs.title: Procedure​
searchDocs.content: Go to sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0/examples/campaignsDuplicate the new-campaign folder, move it and rename itOpen your new folderEdit the .xlsx configuration fileYou can then use the processing user guide to generate your data

searchDocs.content: Export computation UMAPs command Exports all computation UMAPs to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Modules​
searchDocs.content: There are 3 modules shipped with SSE:  Module	DescriptionProcessing	The actions responsible for processing your audio files Front	The user interface running in the web browser Audio	The web server to provide audio files in order to play them back in the browser

searchDocs.content: Export mean distances matrix Exports the mean distances matrix to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Quit
searchDocs.content: Quit danger You will not be able to read from your storage (visualisation) while it is opened by the Processing module. When the Processing module is running, your storage file is kept open thus not available to other programs to reading from it. Use this to properly close and release your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix Remove computation data from your storage file as it will not be consumed by the Front.

searchDocs.title: Run​
searchDocs.content: Type sse followed by a <space>Type the path to your .xlsx file (or drag and drop file icon to the terminal)Press Enter

Choose your action (Use arrow keys) ❯ Refresh configuration Run extractions and aggregations Run reductions --------------- Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix (needed for autocluster) Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix --------------- Run autoclusters Run trajectories Run digests --------------- Run all Export dataframe as .csv Export computation UMAPs as .npy Export mean distances matrix as .npy Repack storage with `h5repack` (UNIX only) --------------- Quit

searchDocs.title: 🔧 Installation
searchDocs.content: 🔧 Installation Installation is divided in two parts: 📋 Requirements 💻 Application

searchDocs.title: Compatibility​
searchDocs.content: While the web app is compatible with most browsers, we experienced random issues with Firefox on Windows 11 and Safari on macOS 14. Thus, we recommend using Chrome.

searchDocs.title: sse_vis command​
searchDocs.content: sse_vis is only available if you have installed the Processingmodule.  This is the quickest command to start both Audio and Front modules.  On an active venv shell window, type the following to start both services (replace the path to your configuration file by drag and dropping the file Excel icon into your shell):  # Windows sse_vis C:\path\to\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS (venv)$> sse_vis /path/to/config.xlsx   After pressing <Enter>, both modules will start and your default browser will open.  note You can also use sse_viz as alias to the sse_vis command.

searchDocs.title: audio:front command​
searchDocs.content: You can serve both Front and Audio modules at the same time  # Windows pnpm audio:front:windows Z:\audio_folder_example # Ubuntu / macOS pnpm audio:front relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: audio command​
searchDocs.content: Serve Audio module on port 5531  pnpm audio -- relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: front command​
searchDocs.content: Serve Front module on port 5530  pnpm front

searchDocs.title: Windows​
searchDocs.content: danger The audio_path on Windows must not contain spaces at the risk of breaking the audio server. If you already generated your processing data, you can fix the audio_pathinside your configuration file and refresh the configuration to see the changes. This is a known blocking issue and a fix is being worked on. Sorry for the inconvenience!  Download sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0.zip ~125 MBExtract archive (use Extract here)Open folder sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0Double click on start.bat (wait for venv creation)Enter command pnpm iEnter command pnpm install:frontEnter command pnpm install:processing:windowsEnter command pnpm install:processing:cuda:windows if you have a CUDA enabled GPU ~2 GBYou can now create a campaign  note pnpm i; pnpm install:front; pnpm install:processing:windows

searchDocs.title: Ubuntu / macOS​
searchDocs.content: Download sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0.zip ~125 MB Extract archive (use Extract here) Open folder sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0 Open a new terminal Type cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0 folder :::tip Drag and drop the folder icon into your terminal to avoid typing the path! ::: Enter command python3.10 -m venv venv Enter command . venv/bin/activate Enter command pnpm i ~50 MB Enter command pnpm install:front ~500 MB Enter command pnpm install:processing ~4 GB Enter command pnpm install:processing:cuda if you have a CUDA enabled GPU ~2 GB You can now create a campaign TODO: You can now activate the virtual environment

searchDocs.title: oneliner​
searchDocs.content: python3.10 -m venv venv && \ . venv/bin/activate && \ pnpm i && \ pnpm install:front && \ pnpm install:processing

searchDocs.title: Windows​
searchDocs.content: Go to sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0Click on start.batYou can now use SSE modules

searchDocs.title: Ubuntu / macOS​
searchDocs.content: Open a terminalType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0Enter command . venv/bin/activateYou can now use SSE modules  tip You can drag and drop the sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0 icon to the terminal instead of typing the path.

searchDocs.title: Manual activation​
searchDocs.content: For advanced users, you can activate the virtual environment manually by running the following commands  # bash / sh . venv/bin/activate # fish source venv/bin/activate.fish # powershell .\venv\Scripts\activate

searchDocs.title: Operating systems​
searchDocs.content: Windows Ubuntu macOS

searchDocs.title: Homebrew​
searchDocs.content: Using the package manager Homebrew is recommended to install the application requirements

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ Procedure​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to brew.shFollow the instructions to install HomebrewOpen a terminal and proceed through next steps

searchDocs.title: 📦 Dependencies​
searchDocs.content: Run the below command to install the dependencies and update your path   C compiler curl ffmpeg Python Node.js pnpm  brew install gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@20 pnpm && \ echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/node@20/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile'

searchDocs.title: 📦 Xcode command line tools​
searchDocs.content: info This step is optional. Context is unclear.

searchDocs.title: ⏭️ Continue​
searchDocs.content: You can now close your terminal and install SSE

searchDocs.title: 📥 Download ~125 MB​
searchDocs.content: Download sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0.zip ~125 MBExtract archive (use Extract here)Open folder sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0Proceed to next steps

searchDocs.title: venv on  Windows​
searchDocs.content: Double click on start.bat and wait for venv creation.

searchDocs.title: venv on  Ubuntu /  macOS​
searchDocs.content: Open a new terminalType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0 folder tip You can drag and drop the folder icon into your terminal instead of typing.  Create venv​  Enter the following command to create a virtual environment  python3.10 -m venv venv   Activate venv​  Enter the following command to activate the virtual environment  . venv/bin/activate

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Windows​
searchDocs.content: Install all modules at once by using the following command  pnpm i; pnpm install:front; pnpm install:processing:windows   tip If you have a compatible GPU, you can install extra dependencies to accelerate processing pnpm install:processing:cuda:windows

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Ubuntu /  macOS​
searchDocs.content: Install all modules at once by using the following command  pnpm i && \ pnpm install:front && \ pnpm install:processing   tip If you have a compatible GPU, you can install extra dependencies to accelerate processing pnpm install:processing:cuda

searchDocs.title: ⏭️ Continue​
searchDocs.content: Go to 🧩 Modules

searchDocs.title: C compiler​
searchDocs.content: In order to install thehdbscan python package later on, a C compiler will be required  You can install it on Windows through the Visual Studio Build Tools

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ Procedure​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to Microsft C++ Build ToolsClick on Download Build Tools to download the executableRun the executable (continue until you get the menu Installing - Visual Studio Build Tools...)Tick Desktop development with C++Press Install (6 Gb of disk space will be used)Wait for completion, you can close the Visual Studio Build Tools window

searchDocs.title: Chocolatey​
searchDocs.content: Using the package manager Chocolatey is recommended to install the application requirements

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ Procedure​
searchDocs.content: Click on the start menu (or press Win button on your keyboard)Type PowerShellRight-click on the PowerShell iconSelect Run as Administrator (this will open a new elevated terminal)Navigate to Chocolatey installation pageScroll to the installation commandCopy the commandPaste it in your terminalPress Enter (wait for the installation to complete)Keep the terminal open and process through the next steps

searchDocs.title: Python​
searchDocs.content: choco install python3 --version=3.10.11 -y

searchDocs.title: 📦 Other dependencies​
searchDocs.content: Node.js pnpm curl ffmpeg  choco install nodejs-lts pnpm curl ffmpeg -y

searchDocs.title: ⏭️ Continue​
searchDocs.content: You can now close your terminal and install SSE

searchDocs.title: 🧩 Modules
searchDocs.content: 🧩 Modules

searchDocs.title: 🚀 Campaign
searchDocs.content: 🚀 Campaign Creating a campaign is the first user step in using SoundScapeExplorer. A campaign will allow you to add audio files, describe user labels, and define intervals and metrics.

searchDocs.title: Oneliner​
searchDocs.content: Using the following command will install all system dependencies  /bin/bash <(wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sound-scape-explorer/sound-scape-explorer/next/bamdad/bin/requirements-ubuntu.sh)

searchDocs.title: System update & small dependencies​
searchDocs.content: curl ffmpeg HDF5 Tools  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt upgrade -y && \ sudo apt install -y curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools

searchDocs.title: Python​
searchDocs.content: sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y software-properties-common && \ sudo add-apt-repository -y ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && \ sudo apt install -y python3.10 python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ curl -sS https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | python3.10

searchDocs.title: Node.js​
searchDocs.content: sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg && \ sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings && \ curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y nodejs

searchDocs.title: pnpm​
searchDocs.content: sudo npm -g i pnpm

searchDocs.title: ⏭️ Continue​
searchDocs.content: You can now close your terminal and install SSE

searchDocs.title: Import
searchDocs.content: Import Load a local .h5 storage file.

searchDocs.title: 📖 User guide
searchDocs.content: 📖 User guide The visualisation interface relies on floating windows to arrange the available viewport. In order for the users customize their workspace, the position for each floating window is saved to browser storage. Following a minimalistic approach, each window can be toggled to be hidden or shown by interacting with the menu icons. Find out more about the 🧭 Menu.

searchDocs.title: Installation procedure​
searchDocs.content: Go to brew.sh and follow the instructions to install HomebrewOpen a terminalInstall external libraries  brew install gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@20 pnpm   Update your $PATH  echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/node@16/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile'   You can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Xcode command line tools​
searchDocs.content: If you encounter problems installing Homebrew, you need to install Xcode command line tools.  info To check if Xcode command line tools are installed, run: xcode-select -p   Open a terminalRun xcode-select --installContinue to Installation procedure

searchDocs.title: Settings​
searchDocs.content: Change the user interface settings.

searchDocs.title: Help​
searchDocs.content: Find help links and keyboard shortcuts.

searchDocs.title: Selection​
searchDocs.content: Select your band, integration, extractor and reducer.

searchDocs.title: Colors​
searchDocs.content: Color intervals based on index, timestamp, label.

searchDocs.title: Labels​
searchDocs.content: Filter intervals based on their labels.

searchDocs.title: Time​
searchDocs.content: Filter intervals based on their timestamps.

searchDocs.title: Details​
searchDocs.content: Show details about the selected interval.

searchDocs.title: Audio​
searchDocs.content: Show audio for the selected interval.

searchDocs.title: Trajectories​
searchDocs.content: Display trajectories.

searchDocs.title: Indicators​
searchDocs.content: Display acoustic indicators.

searchDocs.title: Digested​
searchDocs.content: Display digested metrics.

searchDocs.content: App architecture Please find below a quick overview of the different domains of the app and how they connect to each other.

searchDocs.title: Installation procedure​
searchDocs.content: Open a terminalUpdate your system and install external libraries  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt upgrade -y && \ sudo apt install -y curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools   Install Python  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y software-properties-common && \ sudo add-apt-repository -y ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && \ sudo apt install -y python3.10 python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ curl -sS https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | python3.10   Install Node.js  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg && \ sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings && \ curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y nodejs   Install pnpm  sudo npm -g i pnpm   Close the terminalYou can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Installation procedure​
searchDocs.content: Click on the start menu (or press Win button on your keyboard)Type PowerShellRight-click on the PowerShell iconSelect Run as Administrator (this will open a new shell window)Navigate to chocolatey installation pageScroll to the installation commandCopy the commandPaste it in your shell windowPress Enter (Wait and type choco --version to verify installation)Install Python  choco install python3 --version=3.10.11 -y   info If you have a prior version of Python and want to uninstall it. Run the following command choco uninstall python3 -y   Install Node.js  choco install nodejs-lts --version=20.9.0 -y   Install ffmpeg, curl and pnpm  choco install nodejs-lts ffmpeg curl pnpm -y   Close the shell windowNavigate to Microsft C++ Build ToolsClick on Download Build Tools to download the executableRun the executable (continue until you get the menu Installing - Visual Studio Build Tools...)Tick Desktop development with C++Press Install (6 Gb of disk space will be used)Wait for completion, you can close the Visual Studio Build Tools windowYou can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Available audio formats and codecs
searchDocs.content: Available audio formats and codecs These following formats have been tested with multiple sampling rates, bit depths and variable bitrate (for lossy codecs) wavmp3flac

searchDocs.title: Context​
searchDocs.content: Use this command to extract the .xlsx configuration file from an existing.h5 storage file.  The extracted storage.h5-config-VERSION.xlsx is the actual configuration used to create the storage file.

searchDocs.title: Run​
searchDocs.content: Open a shell window. (Double click start.bat on Windows or use cd on Ubuntu / macOS)Type sse_config followed by a <space>Drag and drop your .h5 storage file to the shell windowPress Enter  Example:  # Windows sse_config C:\to\storage.h5 # Ubuntu / macOS sse_config path/to/storage.h5

searchDocs.content: User flow

searchDocs.title: Python venv activation
searchDocs.content: Python venv activation # bash . venv/bin/activate # fish source venv/bin/activate.fish # powershell .\venv\Scripts\activate

searchDocs.title: Get in touch
searchDocs.content: Get in touch Join us on Discord

searchDocs.title: Visualisation online
searchDocs.content: Visualisation online The Front module is available online. Please remember that you need to serve audio files yourself if you want to access to audio visualization features.

searchDocs.title: Windows​
searchDocs.content: Open the v11.10.0 release pageScroll to AssetsDownload the Source code (zip) fileExtract the downloaded archive (Extract here)Open the extracted folder sound-scape-explorer-VERSIONDouble click on start.bat. Wait for venv creation if neededEnter command pnpm iEnter command pnpm install:frontEnter command pnpm install:processing:windows. If you get an nvidia-*error, please use command pnpm install:processing:cpu:windowsClose the shellYou can now run a campaign

searchDocs.title: Ubuntu / macOS​
searchDocs.content: Open the v11.10.0 release pageScroll to AssetsDownload the Source code (zip) fileExtract the downloaded archive (Extract here)Open the extracted folder sound-scape-explorer-VERSIONOpen a new terminalType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-VERSION. (You can also drag and drop the sound-scape-explorer-VERSION folder)Enter command python3.10 -m venv venvEnter command . venv/bin/activateEnter command pnpm iEnter command pnpm install:frontEnter command pnpm install:processing. If you get an nvidia-*error, please use command pnpm install:processing:cpuClose the terminalYou can now run a campaign

searchDocs.title: Installation procedure​
searchDocs.content: Open a terminalInstall external libraries:  sudo apt install curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools -y   Install Python:  note Press Enter when you are prompted to add the apt repository  sudo apt install software-properties-common -y && \ sudo add-apt-repository ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && \ sudo apt install python3.10 python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv -y && \ curl -sS https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | python3.10   Update .bashrc:  sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/python python /usr/bin/python3.10 0 && \ echo "alias python=python3.10" >> ~/.bashrc && \ echo "alias pip=pip3" >> ~/.bashrc && \ source ~/.bashrc   Install Node.js:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg && \ sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings && \ curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_16.x nodistro main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install nodejs -y   Install pnpm:  sudo npm -g i pnpm   Close the terminalYou can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Installation procedure​
searchDocs.content: Go to brew.sh and follow the instructions to install HomebrewOpen a terminalInstall external libraries:  brew install gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@16 pnpm   Update your $PATH:  echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/node@16/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile'   You can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Xcode command line tools​
searchDocs.content: If you encounter problems installing Homebrew, you need to install Xcode command line tools.  info To check if Xcode command line tools are installed, run: xcode-select -p   Open a terminalRun xcode-select --installContinue to Install requirements

searchDocs.title: Installation procedure​
searchDocs.content: Click on the start menu (or press Win button on your keyboard)Type PowerShellRight-click on the PowerShell iconSelect Run as Administrator (this will open a new shell window)Navigate to chocolatey installation pageScroll to the installation commandCopy the commandPaste it in your shell windowPress Enter (Wait and type choco --version to verify installation)Install Python:  choco install python3 --version=3.10.11 -y   info If you have a prior version of Python and want to uninstall it. Run the following command choco uninstall python3   Install Node.js:  choco install nodejs --version=16.20.0 -y   Install ffmpeg, curl and pnpm:  choco install ffmpeg curl pnpm -y   Close the shell window.Navigate to Microsft C++ Build ToolsClick on Download Build Tools to download the executableRun the executable (continue until you get the menu Installing - Visual Studio Build Tools...)Tick Desktop development with C++Press Install (6 Gb of disk space will be used)Wait for completion, you can close the Visual Studio Build Tools windowYou can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Modules​
searchDocs.content: There are 3 modules shipped with SSE:  Module	DescriptionProcessing	The actions responsible for processing your audio files. Front	The user interface running in the web browser. Audio	The web server to provide audio files in order to play them back in the browser.

searchDocs.title: Module guides​
searchDocs.content: Processing user guide  Visualisation user guide

searchDocs.title: Export computation UMAPs command
searchDocs.content: Export computation UMAPs command Exports all computation UMAPs to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Export mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Export mean distances matrix Exports the mean distances matrix to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix Remove computation data from your storage file as it will not be consumed by the Front.

searchDocs.title: Export dataframe
searchDocs.content: Export dataframe Exports all intervals and associated data to a .csv file.

searchDocs.title: Quit
searchDocs.content: Quit danger You will not be able to read from your storage (visualisation) while it is opened by the Processing module. When the Processing module is running, your storage file is kept open thus not available to other programs to reading from it. Use this to properly close and release your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Refresh configuration
searchDocs.content: Refresh configuration Digest your Excel configuration file and copy all its information inside your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Run all
searchDocs.content: Run all Run all the commands necessary for a complete campaign.

searchDocs.title: Repack storage
searchDocs.content: Repack storage warning This command is only available on UNIX systems at the moment. On Debian based distributions, install it with sudo apt install hdf5-tools When you overwrite a lot to your storage file, the space that was occupied by the deleted dataset is not immediately freed. This is due to how the HDF5 technology works. Repacking allows you to create a new file with your data but with the smallest possible size.

searchDocs.title: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix Run the necessary data for autoclusters to be performed. Those data will never be read in the Front so you can use the purge command to remove it from your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Run​
searchDocs.content: Open a shell window. (Double click start.bat on Windows or use cd on Ubuntu / macOS)Type sse followed by a <space>Drag and drop your Excel file to the shell windowPress Enter  Example:  # Windows sse D:\campaign\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS sse campaign/config.xlsx

searchDocs.title: Most frequent use case​
searchDocs.content: If you want to execute all the requested metrics declared in your configuration file, please use the Run All menu choice.  Select Run AllWait for the processing to complete. When the menu displays again, the processing has completedYou can now go further to visualisation user guidein order to display your data

searchDocs.title: Menu​
searchDocs.content: You will get the menu below.  Use your arrow and Enter keys to navigate through it.  👋 Welcome to SoundScapeExplorer! ┏━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┓ ┃ File ┃ Path ┃ ┡━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┩ │ config │ relative/or/absolute/path/to/config.xlsx │ │ storage │ relative/or/absolute/path/to/storage.h5 │ └─────────┴───────────────────────────────────────────┘ ? Choose your action (Use arrow keys) ❯ Refresh configuration Run extractions and aggregations Run reductions --------------- Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix (needed for autocluster) Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix --------------- Run autoclusters Run trajectories Run digests --------------- Run all Export dataframe as .csv Export computation UMAPs as .npy Export mean distances matrix as .npy Repack storage with `h5repack` (UNIX only) --------------- Quit

searchDocs.title: Commands​
searchDocs.content: Refresh configurationRun extractions and aggregationsRun reductionsRun computation UMAPs and mean distances matrixPurge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrixRun autoclustersRun trajectoriesRun digestsRun allExport dataframeExport computation UMAPsExport mean distances matrixRepack storageQuit

searchDocs.title: Run autoclusters
searchDocs.content: Run autoclusters Automatically attribute numerical clusters (groups) of intervals that are related together depending on your settings. These clusters will appear in the Front as standard labels.

searchDocs.title: Run digests
searchDocs.content: Run digests Take aggregated data and produce derived data using digesters algorithms.

searchDocs.title: Run extractions and aggregations
searchDocs.content: Run extractions and aggregations Extract data from your audio files either through neural networks or indicators algorithms. Take the raw data and aggregate them using your integration settings. tip These raw data can optionally be stored with the persist option.

searchDocs.title: Run trajectories
searchDocs.content: Run trajectories Compute the coordinates of the requested trajectories.

searchDocs.title: Run reductions
searchDocs.content: Run reductions Take the aggregated data produced by neural networks and reduce them using your reducers settings.

searchDocs.title: Requirements​
searchDocs.content: System requirements installedSSE modules installed

searchDocs.title: Windows​
searchDocs.content: Copy the example folder new-campaign located in sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0/examples/campaignsPaste the example folder where you want and rename itOpen your campaign folder and edit the .xlsx configuration fileIn your sound-scape-explorer-VERSION folder, double click on start.batYou can now use SSE modules

searchDocs.title: Ubuntu / macOS​
searchDocs.content: Copy the example folder new-campaign located in sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0/examples/campaignsRename the folder to whatever you wantOpen your campaign folder and edit the .xlsx configuration fileOpen a terminalType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0Enter command . venv/bin/activateYou can now use SSE modules

searchDocs.title: Compatibility​
searchDocs.content: While the web app is compatible with most browsers, we experienced random issues with Firefox on Windows 11 and Safari on macOS 14. Thus, we recommend using Chrome.

searchDocs.title: sse_vis command​
searchDocs.content: sse_vis is only available if you have installed the Processingmodule.  This is the quickest command to start both Audio and Front modules.  On an active venv shell window, type the following to start both services (replace the path to your configuration file by drag and dropping the file Excel icon into your shell):  # Windows sse_vis C:\path\to\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS (venv)$> sse_vis /path/to/config.xlsx   After pressing <Enter>, both modules will start and your default browser will open.  Note You can also use sse_viz or viz as aliases to the sse_vis command.

searchDocs.title: audio:front command​
searchDocs.content: You can serve both Front and Audio modules at the same time  # Windows pnpm audio:front:windows Z:\audio_folder_example # Ubuntu / macOS pnpm audio:front relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: audio command​
searchDocs.content: Serve Audio module on port 5531  pnpm audio -- relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: front command​
searchDocs.content: Serve Front module on port 5530  pnpm front
